title: The X Factor 2014: week two â as it happened | Television & radio | The Guardian
summary: seriously , though ? jake ? you people are awful .
my brother just texted me a picture of the jolly green giant .

text: and that really is it .
four down , twelve to go .
so , as we say goodbye to stephanie and chloe , let me quickly just thank you for coming along and making me miss the first 15 minutes of homeland because i 've got to read all your comments now .

the liveblog returns next saturday , for x factor 's songs from the movies night , where the contestants are almost guaranteed to sing a selection of songs from plays and tv shows and adverts but not from actual films .
if this deluge of gibberish inexplicably is n't enough for you , follow me on twitter ( i 'm @ twitterid ) .
if it is , though , then who could possibly blame you ?
see you next week !
in her best bits package , chloe jasmine makes a really low noise and then a really high noise about 400 times in a row .

documents.title: seriously , though ? jake ? you people are awful .
text: chloe jasmine is eliminated .
eventually , simon sends chloe jasmine home .
she 's done .
and simon waffles on for about a million years , because this is supposed to be the bit where louis takes it to deadlock , and he needs to fill .
mel b votes to send chloe jasmine home .
simon gets the casting vote .
so .
who goes ?
cheryl votes to send stereo kicks home .
louis votes to send chloe jasmine home .
this is n't very good either .
and i kind of want them to go home , because i want to see what sort of face louis walsh will pull when he realises that all his hopes rest with only the young .
i have a feeling it 'll be this face :
and now for stereo kicks .
why do you so sad ?
they sing .
it 's because chloe jasmine just did an impression of one of those nazi aural weapons that makes you involuntarily crap yourselves , that 's why .
but , hey , thanks for asking .
chloe 's singing will you still love me tomorrow .
which we wo n't , obviously , because we are a modern and fickle television audience .
also , because chloe is singing this much in the manner of a buffalo that 's been set on fire and dropped into an abandoned grain silo during karaoke hour .
seriously , i do n't think she hit a single note of that .
still , this means that stereo kicks will go through tonight , because simon cowell does n't have visions of himself splashing around in a lake of liquid gold whenever he thinks of chloe jasmine .
jake , though ?
you people are idiots .

documents.title: jake ?
text: stephanie 's out , by the way .
oh no .
this is all going wrong .
jake ?
jake ?
jake ?
jake ?
jake ?
jake , though ?
jake ?
ok .
the final act through to next week , as i predicted , is jake .
what the hell ?
oh , and chloe 's going to do that overwrought jazz version of the dibbydibbydibbydibby song in the sing-off .
and jake will make a noise like a smoke alarm that 's been given a kicking by a robot .
all these things will happen , for i have spoken .
here 's what i think is about to happen .
through : stereo kicks .
immediately out : stephanie .
sing off : chloe/jake .
jake leaves .
but neither of them are any good and louis takes it to deadlock and we all slightly lose the will to live .
hank kingsley 's through , too .
and lola , who i forgot was even in x factor .
this leaves stereo kicks , chloe , stephanie and jake .
and jack !
jake quickenden to go tonight , i bet .
and jay !
and lauren !
and stevi !
also through : paul !
and andrea obviously !
anyway , where was i ?
oh yes .
eliminations .
safely through to next week are fleur !
and only the young !
because i clearly know nothing about anything .
jay james , stevi richi and simon cowell all together look like il divo after three years of nothing but cider and pasties and fistfights .
anyway , right , concentrate .
we 're going to eliminate two acts now .
one of them will go without warning , so look sharp .
if today has taught me anything , it 's that i should n't drink alcohol at lunchtime if i 'm supposed to be liveblogging in the evening .
if anyone actually makes a song of my maroon 5 lyrics , i promise to put it on the liveblog next week .
there , how 's that for an embarrassingly tiny reward for a comparatively large amount of effort ?
6 ) someone recently tweeted a photo of maroon 5 , but their name was changed to maron 5 because all their faces had been replaced with marc maron 's face .
it was funny .
i ca n't be bothered to find it , but i 've just described it .
just try imagining it , ok ?
try using your imagination for once .
i ca n't be expected to hold your hand all the time .
5 ) i blame kings of leon for this .
some thoughts : 1 ) it appears as if lee mack has recently assumed the job of lead singer of maroon 5 .
2 ) it appears as if 30 % of all the it technicians i 've ever met have recently assumed the job of lead guitarist of maroon 5 .
3 ) the chorus of this song is n't what i thought it 'd be , which is sad .
4 ) lee mack is singing this song in exactly the same way that paul daniels would .
they 're performing their new song animals , which i can only assume will be about their favourite kind of animals .
i have n't heard this song , but i assume that the lyrics to the chorus are elephants , koalas , i love them all so / show me a canary and i 'm ready to go .
i 'll be disappointed if they 're not , really .
but now : a performance from maroon 5 , who inexplicably still exist .
we 're back .
dermot 's doing the same old hey judges , which acts do you like ? '
shtick that he usually does .
mel b still has n't noticed that her bra 's out .
she 'll feel very silly when she notices .
i had a job interview a bit like that once .
what 's bang bang supposed to be about , anyway ?
was n't there an episode of louie where a bang bang meant eating two three-course meals back to back ?
do you think that 's what jessie j does ?
i would n't have thought so , because her ridiculous chainmail net curtain nightie does n't look as if it had been let out .
an ad break now .
this time , including an advert for a product called bronchostop .
remember when it was all yoghurt and john lewis around here ?
christ , we 're all so old .
oh , it 's finished .
still , if you like that song , here 's a youtube video of her singing it , um , differently
jessie j , dressed as the least-prepared knight of the round table in all of history , is singing bang bang .
i think it 's supposed to be the song that 's meant to help her break america , because she keeps using words like cadillac ' and graduate ' and momma ' and imma ' .
at this rate , i 'm fully expecting the final verse to contain references to greyhound buses , disappointing cheese and the incorrect pronunciation of aluminium ' .

anyway , now for the moment you 've all been waiting for , because somehow you have n't quite reached your tolerance for obnoxious attention-seekers who insist on attempting to fit every single note in the musical scale into every single syllable of every single song they sing .
that 's right , it 's jessie j !
and the recap continues .
oh god , one of them was dressed as a telephone .
i 'd forgotten about that .
how the hell did i end up doing this for a job ?
hey , the recap 's still on .
they 're only up to chloe jasmine .
i think i 've worked out why i do n't like her that much , by the way .
i think it 's because she looks a bit like a boy from my primary school who liked to set fire to things .
also , i just noticed that mel b 's bra is out today .
so that 's her and simon cowell who 've forgotten how to do their shirts up .
maybe their thumbs have seized up because they 've caught an airborne virus or something .
i hope it 's not contagious , because the logical conclusion of this is louis walsh walking onstage next week completely naked .
there 's an interminable recap now , so make yourself comfortable .
maybe go and put the kettle on .
maybe go to the toilet .
maybe phone a friend who you 've fallen out of touch with .
maybe go home and talk to your parents about your deepest fears , and systematically work through them until you 've all mutually reached a brand new level of understanding .
it 's fine .
the recap 's still going to be on when you come back .
but now , for the group song .
once again , i do n't have a clue what this song is , but it 's progressing exactly as planned .
all the boys are wearing river island .
all the girls are wearing forever 21 .

there 's a vague feeling that we 've all accidentally walked in on someone else 's end of term school recital , but none of these people are our children so we probably would n't care if a gantry collapsed .
you know , the usual stuff .
and now , let 's see which beloved characters from children 's entertainment the x factor judges are dressed as tonight : louis !
hugh hefner .
mel b !
literally any bride .
cheryl !
beetlejuice .
simon !
the evil capitalist who wants to bulldoze an orphanage , from all the stories where that sort of thing happens .
here 's dermot .
his task for the night is not to look as relentlessly bored as he did last week .
although that should n't be particularly hard he could spend the hour grunting and playing candy crush and he 'd still look comparatively thrilled about being there .
last night : people dressed weird , nobody sang any songs from the 1980s and louis walsh talked about penises a lot .
but you already knew that .
ok , here we go .
let 's destroy some dreams .
once again , by the way , i 'm stumped about who 'll go this week .
i 'm convinced that one of the boys will leave probably jack , but i 've said that before and the judges are giving stephanie such a gleeful kicking that i 'd be staggered if she survives the night .
then again , fleur did a rap and x factor audiences traditionally hate rapping women .
and , to be fair , most of the others were a bit crap as well .
who knows who the losers are ?
apart from us , obviously .
always apart from us .

documents.title: the wildly-anticipated sunday results bit
text: oh hi there , you came back .
you know , it means a lot that not even the threat of jessie j can dissuade you from abandoning me .
it gets me right here .
anyway , welcome to the sunday night results part of this week 's x factor liveblog .

you 'll remember that last night was x factor 's eighties night , not because all the songs were from the eighties ( because they were n't ) , or because all the contestants were alive in the eighties ( because they really were n't ) , but because eighty songs were performed and the show lasted for eighty hours and by the time it was finished we all looked as if we were in our mid-to-late eighties .
but this is no place for me to gripe about the unnecessarily huge amount of x factor contestants this year , because it 's another double elimination .
that 's right tonight , two acts will exit the show , leaving just 12 finalists .

admittedly there were 12 finalists when the show began a couple of weeks ago , which means that x factor could have just ditched the wildcard element and given me an extra fortnight of not having to work , but never mind .
double elimination !
whee !
so there 's that to look forward to .
and jessie j .
and maroon 5 .
and a recap so unaccountably vast in scale that it would literally make god weep .
join me , wo n't you ?
back at 8pm .
and now , while we enter into the unbearable neverending recap of doom , it 's time for me to say goodbye .
thanks very much for coming along and joining in .
your comments , without wanting to sound too much like a broken record , are really the best thing about this whole sorry enterprise .
hey !
why not follow me on twitter ?
i 'm @ twitterid .
if not , just come straight back here at 8pm tomorrow for the results show , when we 'll all be treated to a cavalcade of adverts and recaps and , hopefully , the end of jack whatshisname .
deal ?
great .
oh , by the way , jessie j 's also performing .
no , wait , come back !
x factor clearly wants everyone to throw their weight behind jay .
but it was all a little muted .
the studio audience were much more muted than they should have been .
i remain unsold .
it did n't get overwrought , at least .
it was shaping up to be one of those horrible x factor performances that ends with a marching band and a choir of candle-holding children .
but it did n't .
it just ended with jay making a noise like a slowly-deflating campsite mattress .
this is less a song and more a demonstration of how desperately jay james wants to perform on the soundtrack of a john lewis advert .
oh jesus , jay james is doing a james blunt version of that proclaimers song that people pretend to like when they 're drunk .
this is not very good , because it 's a ballad and i have a horrible feeling that it 's going to get really overwrought really quickly .
and finally , tonight 's last act !
it 's jay james .
but who knows which jay james we 'll get tonight the annoying , insipid jay james from the audition or the annoying , infinitesimally less insipid jay james from last week 's live show ?
i do n't know about you , but i 'm on tenterhooks .
this week , jay james has started to dress like olly murs , which can not possibly be a good thing in anyone 's eyes .
in other news , i quite like that song that goes dibbydibbydibbydibbydibbydibbydibbydibby ' .
i 'd like chloe jasmine to do an agonising jazz version of that next week , please .
i 've just noticed that one of only the young was dressed as a telephone .
oh , those crazy guys !
someone should tell them that it is n't halloween for another two weeks !
what a world !
oh wait , mel b liked that .
all the things in the entire universe , and this is the only one that mel b likes .
i think i 've gone right off her .
ah , forget that .
only the young have modernised come on eileen .
by which i mean that it sounds like cotteneye joe now .
without exaggeration , if there was a knife near me right now , i would have chopped my ears off .
right off .
and then eaten them .
my god .
they 're doing come on eileen .
a slowed-down , acoustic version of come on eileen , obviously , because you idiots have n't made me king yet .
next to perform are only the young , essentially the kids from funny games doing jive bunny karaoke .
still , at least they 're spending the entire duration of their vt slagging off their song choice .
this should be fun .
signs that stevi might be buying into his own hype : he 's started to call people mate ' instead of using their first name .
next week he 'll turn up in sunglasses .
the week after he 'll kick a runner in the shins for giving him the wrong colour m & ms .
he 's becoming a right monster , and no mistake .
ok , panic over .
stevi 's ballad remains holstered for another week .
this is because , tonight , stevi is putting all of his effort into rickrolling us .
this performance is basically a berserk fantasyscape where stevi gets to sexually assault a load of identical women at once on a red carpet while doing a dance like he 's wearing a filled nappy .
by rights , it should end with six-year-old stevi waking up in bed .
but it does n't .
it really happened .
and that 's something we all have to live with .
so , here 's my theory about stevi .
you will have heard of chekov 's gun the theory that , if a gun is shown during a story , that gun will be fired to disastrous effect before the story ends .
well , after last week 's post-song interview , i 'm now living in constant fear of stevi 's ballad .
in the vt , stevi asks us to boogie , stevi style ' .
i guarantee that this will not happen .
oh , no , wait .
three contestants .
i forgot about stevi .
like an idiot .
as far as i can tell , there 's more than half an hour of x factor left .
and , if i 've done my maths right , only two contestants .
i tell you what , that 's going to be one hell of a recap coming up .

documents.title: a fun fact
text: the actual 1980s were n't as long as this episode .
a theory : if you cut paul akister open , antony costa would crawl out .
paul 's doing if you do n't know me by now .
which is a shame , because i actually do n't know him by now which , by his logic , means that i will never ever know him .
oh well , my loss i guess.i mean it , though .
i genuinely do n't know who he is .
i thought he looked completely different to this .
still , i may as well not commit him to memory , because this is all a bit barry from eastenders performing at the halftime intermission of a regional crown green bowls tournament .
paul akister now , who somehow managed to avoid the curse of the first act by not being voted out last week .

this might have been because he 's a good singer , but i think it 's more to do with the fact that he does n't look like ben mitchell off eastenders and the audience were less petrified about him crawling through the tv screen and murdering them .
mel b did n't like the song .
this is because mel b does n't like anything .
i 'd quite like mel b to star in a spin-off show , where she sits on a conveyor belt and things go past her and she shouts dismissively at all of them .
norr !
robbish !
thass crap !
norr !
gerrout ! .
tell me you would n't watch that .
because i would watch that all day .
still , fame is a good song choice for her , because she does wants to live forever .
and , you know what , i think she might .
admittedly that 's mainly because she looks like a haunted painting of a poodle , but you have to take what you can get .
chloe 's singing fame .
i 'm going to sing it like you 've never heard she promised in the vt. and she 's right .
if you 'd never heard heard her sing toxic in exactly the same way last week , she would be singing in a way that you 've never heard .
now for boris johnson .
actually , i 'm going to use her real name from now on .
it 's chloe jasmine .
i 'm going to use her real name because , despite x factor 's best efforts , the audience clearly does n't hate her .
so i 'll just use her real name and let her get kicked off the show after five weeks like nature intended .
oh christ , chloe jasmine 's vt contains incidental music from it 's always sunny in philadelphia .
hey itv , stop ruining the incidental music of sitcoms i like tonight .

documents.title: my brother just texted me a picture of the jolly green giant
text: i think it 's a reference to cheryl 's dress .
i think he wants to be mentioned in the liveblog .
hello pete .
also , this counts as your birthday card this year .
tonight , right before every ad break , dermot has thrown to the backstage area .
every time , we 've seen a male contestant and a female contestant together .
and every time , the female contestant has either been applying make-up or having her hair done , and the male contestant has been sort of mournfully staring off into space by himself .
i do n't know what sort of point i 'm trying to make , but i bet i can get a comment is free article commissioned about it .
the problem with jake singing a song like this is that you ca n't help but wonder what it 'd sound like in andrea 's hands .
the answer , obviously , is that it 'd be : a ) betterb ) louderc ) renamed toooo-hoooo-haaaaa-oooo-tally cleepada hurhh-urgh-ar-aghh-tuh .
jakes doing total eclipse of heart .
because every time there 's a camera on him , he falls apart .
burn .
actually , they just did this song on strictly come dancing .
that 's a difficult song they said afterwards , perhaps because they knew it was about to be performed by a barely sentient instagram selfie on the other side .
next : jake quickenden .
last week simon told jake that he needed to put some grit in his voice .
unless i misheard him , and the word he actually used was quit ' .
i hope i misheard him .
this week , mel b basically did everything in her power to demonstrate to jake that she does n't like him very much .
i am all for her .
cheryl just said that butterflies are the sign of an angel .
god , imagine how screwed we 'd all be if cheryl had taught us gcse science .

i 'm really enjoying this performance , because i 've always wondered what john lennon would be like if he was a stacey slater lookalike who constantly appeared to be fighting off wave after wave of powerful nausea .
lola 's singing imagine .
hey guys , imagine a version of x factor that is n't longer than the extended version of blade runner .
am i right ?
guys ?
anyway , now for lola saunders .
i ca n't remember a single thing about lola , other than that she does n't want to be known as a singing fishmonger .
if she 'd said that did n't want to be known as the best singer in the competition , that 's how i would have remembered her .
but , no , lola the singing fishmonger it is .
in the vt , lola either does that i love you / i love you more / no , i love you more ' thing with her grandfather , or i 've just witnessed something truly nightmarish .
now for that awful scatted carphone warehouse advert .
this week , i discovered that the advert was written by adam buxton , and subsequently lost all faith in everyone i ever respected as a child .

documents.title: the halfway point
text: hey , x factor has already been on for 70 minutes tonight .
how should we celebrate ?
with 70 more minutes of x factor ?
no .
but how will we celebrate ?
will 70 more minutes of x factor .
oh .
cheryl 's expressing concern that erect kiosks do n't inspire the correct level of lust in the traditional boyband market .

i 'd suggest that this is because it 's 9pm on a saturday evening , and the traditional boyband market is either fast asleep or in a provincial town 's memorial garden getting hammered on â£ 3 cider .
mainly , though , i 'm just mesmerised by the hair .
the perfectly identical hair .
it 's like they 're all wearing liberace wigs .
it 's an exceptional feat of engineering .
erect kiosks are performing boys of summer .
because some of them are boys , and it's¦ ah , no , that does n't work .
maybe they just like crap songs .
erect kiosks are doing the same old shtick as last week , where the four best looking ones sing the first verse , and then the other four wander on and join in with the rest of it .
if i was in erect kiosks , i 'd totally want to be in the latter group .
you 'd get paid the same money for doing half the work .
is n't that the dream ?
now for stereo kicks .
i got bored earlier this week and discovered that an anagram of stereo kicks is erect kiosks .
so that 's what i 'll be calling them from now on .
in the vt , stereo kicks lark around having pillow fights .
although , given the huge age discrepancy between the members , we 're basically just watching a 20-year-old man attack a child .
saturday night entertainment !
mel b said that she could hear fleur singing the chorus .
so fleur sang the chorus , and mel b rolled her eyes so hard that i think she might have pulled all the ligaments in her face .
in short : mel b wins everything forever .
this is a genuine thing that actually happened : i was watching fleur perform , and i thought wow , this is just like watching an established popstar .
then i realised that the established popstar in question was kelis .
fleur begins her performance lying down on a giant record player .
then she stands up and immediately starts rapping .
she 's ostensibly singing it 's a shame , by the way .
because , you know , it 's a shame that nobody ever mentions her being in addictiv ladies nine years ago .
now for fleur east , who last week sang an ode to the beauty of plump ladies despite being about 95 % abdominal muscles .
hopefully this week she 'll continue the theme by singing a song about the beauty of not having a sideshow bob haircut .
dermot is now showing everyone what all the judges looked like in the 1980s .
they 'd do the same with the contestants , except that 'd mainly involve showing a lot of photographs of their dads ' testicles .
probably best that they left it .
hold the phone , here 's an advert about x factor 's backstage shenanigans .

apparently it basically involves lots more tresemme use and lots less instances of children crying because they ca n't possibly hope to meet the impossible standards of an invisible audience than i expected .

documents.title: it is christmas now
text: wait , is this is this a christmas advert ?
you know , i think it actually is !
it 's christmas , everyone !
let 's all get drunk and ignore our families !
merry christmas !
who wants some more adverts ?
nobody ?
well tough tits , because here 's a load more adverts .
as rubbish as that performance was , though , i want hank to stay on x factor .
because it gives me an excuse to embed this video of a man saying his surname over and over again .
louis just said you 've got the big package to hank , presumably because he wanted to explode twitter .
this is like paolo nutini going to the world 's iffiest halloween party as chico .
and that 's why i 'm afraid i 'm out .
hank 's singing a horrible boom-bap version of jealous guy .
and i know what you 're thinking you 're thinking that that 's not an eighties song .
but it is technically a 1980s song , because john lennon almost made it a full year into the 1980s before being murdered .
that 's how these theme nights work , is n't it ?
next up is hank kingsley .
as we discovered last week , hank 's big trick is to yell everything like he 's having unanaesthetised surgery carried out on his perineum by a madman with a chainsaw .
that wo n't get old really bloody quickly , will it ?
which is to say , that was really disappointing .
the song went nowhere , the vocals were a bit iffy , it made me think about what will happen when i die .
even more so than i usually do during an episode of x factor .
lauren 's singing what a feeling from flashdance .
she 's singing it while standing in front of a spotlight and reaching out towards the camera , which i suspect is the sort of thing you see as you approach heaven immediately after dying .
which is great , because i 've always assumed that heaven is full of children yelling horrible slow versions of songs from crap films that were made several years before they were born .
lauren platt now , and i 'm actually really excited about this .
lauren was the surprise standout of last week 's show , and i think she 's going to go far .
let 's see how she does singing a song that 's a minimum of twice her age , though .
in the vt , lauren basically just goes i was n't alive in the eighties ' over and over again , and you feel like the oldest arsehole who ever lived .
it 's not the greatest sales tactic , admittedly .
adverts again now , including a nice reminder that you can get a train from london to manchester in less time that it takes to watch tonight 's episode of x factor .
so , you know , yay for that .
cheryl asks andrea if there 's anything he ca n't sing .
on the basis of that last song , i 'd say only making one-syllable words last for one syllable ' .
yup , there he goes .
i love andrea very much , but he does just treat songs as an excuse to make a noise like a goat on a rollercoaster .
agh , i was so close .
tonight on andrea basically just shouts a load of vowels : one moment in time .
someone ready the fire extinguisher .
but not just yet , because his performance starts off all small and weird .
this is a trick , of course , because we all know that he 's going to scream the last chorus like a toddler throwing a tantrum in the tinned food aisle of tesco .
andrea faustini , now .
i 'm worried about where andrea can go after yelling earth song so loudly last week .
how can he possibly top that ?
unless he somehow learns how to spontaneously combust during the high note of the greatest love of all , i 'm not sure that he can .

in the vt , andrea professes his love for traditional british things : fish and chips , cups of tea , wearing ironic jumpers , top hats , excessive property rental prices , pretending to enjoy x factor , that sort of thing .
cheryl 's praising stephanie to the skies .
the real question , though , is whether or not we can trust the word of a woman who walks around with an aeroplane flight pillow stapled to her shoulder .

you know those little wooden toys you used to get , where a wooden man stood on a wooden plinth , and when you pushed your thumb into the bottom of the plinth , some strings go slack and the person collapses ?
that is literally the only dance move that stephanie knows .
stephanie 's doing call me .
a reggae version of call me , obviously , because she 's only allowed to do one thing .
i hope stephanie stays , because next week she 's going to sing that stallholder frog song from parappa the rapper .
we 're back .
and stephanie nala 's next .
now , i like stephanie .
i think she has a beautiful voice , and i thought she handled herself well in the sing-off last week .
that 's why i look forward to seeing the judges call her a worthless one-trick-pony for the next fortnight before she cracks and actually leaves .

in one advert : kevin bacon says bacon do n't like waiting ' without even realising for a second that bacon ' does n't rhyme with waiting'.in another advert : the name brian ' is used pejoratively .
again .
in another advert : paul whitehouse does one of those car insurance adverts where , although it 's not made explicit , his character has been dead all along .
but now , some adverts .
simon just called jack very commercial ' .
specifically he 's this commercial
i know i 'm asking to be made king in a traditionally republican publication , but look at him .
look at him , murdering a good song with his stupid guitar and silly shirt and rubbish jeans .
i could lead you away from all this .
all you need to do is make me king .
i would be a merciful king .
jack 's singing straight up by paula abdul .
but , because this is jack poxy walton , he 's doing it on an acoustic guitar .
listen , someone make me king , because my first thing i 'll do will be to torch the radio one live lounge down , and then we wo n't have to put up with any of this nonsense any more .
deal ?
first !
its time for jack walton .
there will now be a moment of silence in which you can try to remember which one jack walton is .
when you work it out , tell me .
i have n't got a clue .
oh , one of one direction likes jack walton .
the one who ca n't grow a moustache properly .
you know the one i 'm talking about .
oh , good news .
it 's another double eviction this week .
maybe it 'll be a double eviction every week .
we 'd be done by november that way .
even though i 'm already bored of this bit , let 's meet the judges !
louis !
no tie .
mel !
dressed as a dinosaur 's tongue .
cheryl !
a lilypad with a pair of dentures plonked on it .
simon !
literally just simon cowell .
oh , here 's dermot .

this is how relevant the 1980s is to the modern x factor audience : they just had to literally show a brief 1980s montage , to prove that the decade actually happened and was n't just a crazy story invented by dribbling old people .
last week : mel b briefly started behaving like johnny 5 from short circuit .
that is all that happened last week .
it 's time !
to face !
the autumn/winter 2014 asos collection !
i do not care for the homepride advert that uses the curb your enthusiasm incidental music .
it makes me worried that fred 's about to inappropriately use the c-word in a restaurant or something .
still , we 'll have to face tonight 's show without blonde electra or overload generation who , between them , made up 50 % of louis walsh 's category this year .

that 's not to say that 50 % of his performers have been eliminated , of course , because blonde electra and overload generation only had seven singers in them combined , compared to the 12 that remain in only the young and stereo kicks .
so , for louis walsh to fully halve his chances , he would have had to lose blonde electra , only the young and two and a half members of stereo kicks .
maybe in some sort of nightmarish combine harvester accident .
or by falling down some stairs face-first while carrying a tray of knives and dirty syringes .
oh , there i go , daydreaming again .
hello everyone , and welcome to week two of the x factor liveblog 2014 !
and this is a very special week indeed .

not only because overload generation were kicked out last week , which means i do n't have to make any more tortured jokes about one of them looking a bit like ben mitchell off eastenders , but because it 's 80s night !
hooray !
the 1980s !
everyone loves the 1980s , do n't they ?
you do , your parents do , even dermot o'leary did a happy little fist-pump when he revealed tonight 's theme last week .
( although , incidentally , dermot 's kidding nobody .
the only thing that would genuinely make dermot o'leary pump his fists with glee is if x factor temporarily lost its mind and staged a turin breaks theme night ) .
anyway , everyone loves the 1980s !

except for the acts who 'll be performing on x factor tonight , of course , because only about three of them are actually old enough to have been born in the 1980s , so this may as well be ragtime week or lute week or old-timey gold prospector banjo music week for all it matters to them .
nevertheless , i 'm glad that you 'll be with me for the next two and a bit hours .
you know how it works by now i commentate up here , you complain about the new liveblog layout down there , and together we march to glory .
hooray for the 1980s !
see you at 8pm .

SERIOUSLY, THOUGH? JAKE? YOU PEOPLE ARE AWFUL.

MY BROTHER JUST TEXTED ME A PICTURE OF THE JOLLY GREEN GIANT

bulletin.text: This week, X Factor introduced its contestants to the 1980s and then eliminated two of them. Here's the whole weekend as it happened, with Stuart Heritage.
